revised_title: Infection and Transmission of Trypanosoma gambiense in Antelopes
tldr: The article discusses the infection and transmission of Trypanosoma gambiense in antelopes. The authors found that waterbuck, bushbuck, and reedbuck can be infected with a human strain of the parasite, and that laboratory-bred Glossina palpalis flies can transmit the virus to susceptible animals. The study also shows that antelopes can remain infected for a year and that a duiker, another species of antelope, can also be infected with the same strain of T. gambiense.
